definition: approved by His (or Her) Majesty/permission graciously granted (from highly authoritative position)/to graciously permit/to condescend to allow
to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of

sentences.english: Golly , Uncle, with God's permission I'll do any job there is.
sentences.chinese: 天啊，叔叔，蒙主的恩准，有什麼工作我都能做啊。

sentences.english: If it please Your Grace, we want no part of him.
sentences.chinese: 若陛下恩准，我們可不想他摻一腳。

sentences.english: Bobbie Bonti is deep in thought as her husband Gene prepares dinner for her.
sentences.chinese: 吉恩准備晚餐時，妻子博比在旁邊陷入沉思。

sentences.english: The group enjoyed the full endorsement and blessing of the Vatican.
sentences.chinese: 天主事工會得到了梵帝岡的完全認可和恩准。

sentences.english: After Xiaoming pleaded constantly, his mother finally allowed him to spend his summer holiday by the sea.
sentences.chinese: 小明一再請求，媽媽終於恩准他暑假可以去海邊旅遊。

sentences.english: I'm afraid that her parents will not consent to her marriage.
sentences.chinese: 我擔心她的父母不會恩准她的婚事。

sentences.english: God grants them the forgiveness of sins and the Holy Spirit.
sentences.chinese: 神恩准他們罪得赦免，賜予他們聖靈。

sentences.english: I'm not betting on it being paid.
sentences.chinese: 我不敢下注，這個報銷能否得到恩准。

sentences.english: Then was the hour in which he granted rest to his servants.
sentences.chinese: 接下來的時間他恩准他的僕從們休息。

definition: to give a favor (used of Christian God)
courtier's or minister's form of address for the current Emperor
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
imperial edict/see also 上諭|上谕[shang4 yu4]
to confess one's fault/to accept one's punishment
